results.title: Beer
results.creator_credit: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Presents an examination of beer production. Indicates the processing stages, and the resulting outputs of products, by-products and wastes. Chemical processes in fermentation are also considered. The program lends itself to students developing a flow chart of the manufacturing system, with inputs of various values, quantities and types.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television New Zealand

results.title: Beef cattle in Australia
results.creator_credit: Fred Whatham and Cine Australian Productions
results.brief_description: A concise description of the Australian beef cattle industry, covering such aspects as marketing, breeding, mustering and transportation. Narrated by Roger Climpson.
results.description: A concise description of the Australian beef cattle industry, covering such aspects as marketing, breeding, mustering and transportation. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Beef business
results.creator_credit: B. Salt, A. Frank Bundy, British Information Services and Wallace Productions
results.brief_description: A film showing the best ways of making beef production profitable through different methods of grazing, feeding, breeding and marketing.

results.title: Beechworth Victoria
results.brief_description: Shows Australia’s oldest gold mining town, Beechworth through the eyes of a visiting young couple. No other credits available.

results.title: Beechworth [B&W]
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and National Trust
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
Historic buildings of the former gold mining town of Beechworth, Vic., including the gold office, prison, powder magazine, churches and the Court House where Ned Kelly was tried three times.

results.title: Beech foresters
results.brief_description: This film reviews the extent and nature of beech forests in New Zealand and describes schemes undertaken for improvement. Draws attention to the work of the New Zealand Forest Service in carrying out aerial and ground surveys and compiling information, resulting in such schemes as the erection of deer-proof fences, selection of seed trees and the establishment of even age forests. Describes the uses to which timber is put. No other credits available.

Describes the uses to which timber is put. No other credits available.

results.title: Bedouins of Arabia
results.creator_credit: Richard Taylor and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Portrays the life of Bedouin tribesmen in the Arabian desert, noting their relationships with each other and with the land. Suitable for upper primary and secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Becoming a student again
results.creator_credit: John Garrity and Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: A motivational program aimed at putting mature-age students at ease with the idea of returning to study at TAFE colleges. Indicates the process of enrolment, the expectations of students and the TAFE colleges, and the problems likely to be encountered at home by mature age students.

results.title: Becoming a reader
results.brief_description: Presents interviews with various reading experts who indicate a positive approach to parents assisting their children in the reading process. Also shows the types of activities that may be applied by parents to encourage reading and writing.
